description: Variation of condition 2 (approved drawings) attached to planning permission 2022/0941 dated 06/06/2022. Effect of variation would be to substitute the green roof with a rainwater harvesting system and to install a traditional dormer in place of the inverse dormer.
decision_conditions:
Soundproofing shall be provided to ensure that dwelling houses, flats and rooms for residential purposes sharing a party element with a premises to which this planning permission relates shall receive a minimum airborne sound insulation on the party element which achieves DnT'w of 60 dB before the first use of the development hereby approved. The soundproofing shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.




REASON: To ensure that neighbouring occupiers do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise from activities within the premises

The noise level from all plant and machinery included in the approved development shall at all times remain 5dB(A) below background levels when measured at any nearby residential window or other sensitive receptor if appropriate (add/delete as appropriate)




REASON: To ensure that occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance and other excess noise.

The windows in the flank elevations (east and west) at first floor level shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level.




REASON: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers.

All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.




REASON: To safeguard the visual appearance of the host building and the area.

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved the following shall be provided in full;</p><p><br></p><p>a) the soft landscaping in the curtilage of the building as shown on the submitted drawings</p><p><br></p><p>b) the water butt as shown on the submitted drawings and in accordance with approved details</p><p><br></p><p>The above shall be retained and maintained in perpetuity thereafter.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that additional greenery is provided at the site and to reduce surface water run-off.</p><div><br></div>

The refuse store, cycle store and new gate shall not be higher than the existing boundary treatment of the site and shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation/use of the development and retained in perpetuity.




REASON: To safeguard the visual amenity of the area.

The development hereby approved shall provide the following, as set out in the submitted drawings prior to first occupation and shall be retained as such in perpetuity;


a) Cycle storage and parking


b) Refuse storage



REASON: To safeguard the visual amenity of the site and in the interests of sustainable transport.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than 06/06/2025.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>The residential accommodation hereby permitted shall be ancillary to the ground floor use of the building only and shall not be used as an independent self-contained dwelling.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the residential use is ancillary and does not provide a conflict of potential uses on the site and to safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the residential accommodation.</p>

Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, prior to the occupation of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation/use of the development and retained in perpetuity .


Full details of the water-butt, including capacity and details of the overflow 


REASON: To reduce surface water run-off and to ensure that suitable sustainable urban drainage is provided.

All non-Combined Heat and Power (CHP) space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers installed as part of the development hereby approved shall achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh.


REASON: To protect air quality and people's health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a minimum as a result of the development and to contribute towards the maintenance or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality Objectives.

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
